flashcards.english: Pattern: Subject + ngĩ + verb + no + result. 2nd Singular: Ũngĩthoma no ũhĩge? (if you read/learn, would you become sharp/clever?), 1st Singular: Ĩngĩthoma no njũhĩge (if I read/learn I would become sharp/clever), 1st Plural: Tũngĩthoma no tũhĩge (if we read/learn we would become sharp), 3rd Plural: Mangĩthoma no mohĩge (if they read/learn they would become sharp)
flashcards.notes: Conditional tense with consequence clause using 'no' (then). Vocabulary: Kũhĩga (to be sharp/clever), Kahiu kogĩ (sharp knife - adjective example). Shows if-then conditional structure across persons
